vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
κυλλ-ός, ή, όν,
club-footed and bandy-legged, opposed to βλαισός, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; κ. πούς[Refs 5th c.BC+]
__2 generally, deformed, contracted, κ. οὖς [Refs 5th c.BC+]; crippled in the arm, κ. ἠκόντιζεν ἀμείνονα [NT+1st c.AD+]; ἔμβαλε κυλλῇ (i.e. χειρί) put into a crooked hand, i.e. with the fingers crooked like a beggar's, to catch an alms, [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__2 of things, crooked, κ. κυκλάς [Refs 6th c.AD+]
__II κυλλά, τά, choliambi, [Refs 3rd c.BC+]
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
crippled, maimed
primarily crooked, bent, maimed, lame, crippled, Mt. 18:8; Mk. 9:43, used as a noun meaning cripple, Mt. 15:30ff.*
vocabInfos._zh_tw_Definition: 跛腳的, 身體殘缺的
vocabInfos._zh_Definition: 跛脚的, 身体残缺的
